events.message: The applicant has submitted the personal loan application to cover medical expenses from recent surgery and related treatment costs.
Loan department has categorised the application as a personal loan, identifying medical expenses as the primary purpose.
A loan officer with experience in personal loan cases has been assigned to assist the applicant throughout the process.
Preliminary review of the submitted application confirms completeness but requires verification of medical expense documentation.
Applicant has been requested to provide detailed hospital bills, doctor's notes, and proof of insurance coverage for assessment.
Applicant submitted all requested medical bills, insurance statements, and prescriptions needed for thorough loan evaluation.
Credit bureau report received showing a satisfactory credit score and history with no recent defaults or late payments.
Risk analysis completed indicating moderate risk based on income stability and amount requested for medical expense coverage.
Loan offer prepared and communicated to applicant including interest rate, repayment schedule, and loan terms suitable to needs.
Applicant has reviewed the loan offer and provided positive feedback, expressing agreement with the loan terms and repayment plan.
Application has been escalated to the underwriting team for final validation due to the relatively high loan amount requested.
Underwriting completed approval of the personal loan, confirming all criteria were met and risk deemed acceptable.
Funds from the approved personal loan have been disbursed to the applicant's bank account for immediate use in medical payments.
Follow-up conducted with applicant to confirm receipt of funds and satisfaction with the process and loan conditions.
The loan application has been closed successfully after confirmation that the applicant is using funds as intended for medical needs.
